Novels.title: Summer Fun
Novels.content: An novel in letters about a trans woman who lives in New Mexico and who is a real true fan of a certain band. Forthcoming, Soho Press, 2021.

Novels.title: The Dream of Doctor Bantam
Novels.content: In mourning after the suicide of her sister, a young woman begins working as a housekeeper for her crush, who belongs to a cult that does not believe in linear time. Lambda Literary Award Finalist. OR Books, 2012.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Myra's Seven Conversations
The Black Emerald (stories).content: The emotionally unavailable owner of a bed and breakfast offers a conversation service for women who want to fall in love with her. Written 2011.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Myra's Seven Conversations
The Black Emerald (stories).content: The emotionally unavailable owner of a bed and breakfast offers a conversation service for women who want to fall in love with her. Written 2011.

Stories (Uncollected).title: The Fountainhead
Stories (Uncollected).content: The teenage fan of a problematic novelist-philosopher works at an office supply store. Evergreen Review 2.3, March 2019.

Stories (Uncollected).title: White People Anonymous
Stories (Uncollected).content: A trans woman is required to join a twelve-step group for white women recovering from online racism. n+1, March 2018.

Stories (Uncollected).title: Angels Are Here to Help You
Stories (Uncollected).content: In a mysterious future, one trans woman and her famous cat set out for the stars to start a hallucinogenic drug company. In Meanwhile, Elsewhere, Topside: 2017.

Stories (Uncollected).title: The L7 Gene
Stories (Uncollected).content: On returning home for Thanksgiving, a trans woman learns that her mother has created a cis clone of her. WIRED, January 2017.

Stories (Uncollected).title: Tipping Point
Stories (Uncollected).content: An actor approaches some trans women with a Proposition. WSQ, Fall/Winter 2016.

Stories (Uncollected).title: Red Velvet LLC
Stories (Uncollected).content: Two trans folks attempt to start a bakery company. Twitter Fiction Festival, 2015.

Stories (Uncollected).title: Vampire Book Tour
Stories (Uncollected).content: Clearly totally fictional story about vampires. Pushcart nominee. In Where We're Going We Don't Need Roads, Topside: 2014.

Comics.title: We're Still Here
Comics.content: The first all-trans comics anthology (as far as we know.) Editor, with Tara Madison Avery. Lambda Literary Award finalist; Ignatz Award nominee. 2018.

Comics.title: Diary Comix
Comics.content: Mostly drawn on the subway to work. 2016-present.

Comics.title: Bad Mother
Comics.content: A young queer woman raises a child to take on the world. 2012-2016.

Comics.title: The Man Who Hates Fun
Comics.content: The heavily crosshatched adventures of a Stoic philosopher and his long-suffering pals. 2004-2012, mostly: I draw new ones sometimes.

Comics.title: Diary of a Ghost Girl
Comics.content: A teen falls in love with her own diary. Never completed. 2010-2012.

Games.title: Capitalism 1
Games.content: A short game about what capitalism is like. Construct2, 2014.

Games.title: Capitalism Zero: Crisis in the Stars
Games.content: An ongoing game project about a strange dream. HTML/CSS/JS, 2018-present.

Games.title: Capitalism 2: Planet of the Death Dragons
Games.content: You and your pal will definitely get the better of capitalism this time. Construct2, 2014-present (unfinished).

Games.title: Immortal Defense
Games.content: A weird tower defense game based on ideas about immortality + violence in games. Just the story. I was very young! Studio Eres, Gamemaker, 2007.

Publishing.title: Instar Books
Publishing.content: A current obsession about which i will write more later!

Publishing.title: Freelance Editorial
Publishing.content: For years I made my living doing freelance editorial work for [various|http://greenleafbookgroup.com] [clients|http://stackeddeckpress.com].

About.content:
Jeanne Thornton is the author of a bunch of things listed on this site. She is one of the recipients of the [Judith A Markowitz Emerging Writers Award|https://www.lambdaliterary.org/emerging-writer-award/], as well as a [Lambda Literary|http://lambdaliterary.org] Fellow and a three-time Lambda Literary Award finalist. She is one of the publishers of [Instar Books|http://www.instarbooks.com].

She is sometimes available for freelance work, [please inquire|mailto:jwthornton@gmail.com]!
